Reviews.Title: “Very Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: BenacreCouple
Reviews.Content: The rooms a very basic but clean. Staff are friendly and helpful but overworked as they multitask. restaurant menu basic but just adequate. had sweet served still frozen. obviously microwaved. breakfast items ran out due to too many people arriving af same time. It was breakfast time so should have been prepared. Stayed for two nights while visiting excel exhibition. rooms on upper floors facing airport create an interest. not over noisy and no flights after 10 oclock ish. car park £7.50 per 24 hours. ok but no security barrier in operation.not too many visitors during our stay so could be big problems with food etc when busy. probably wouldnt use again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm an optimist; but this place hasn't got a lot going for it”
Reviews.Author: RWJanssen
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I missed my flight from LCY and no other option but to wait for next morning's 07:00 AM departure to Zurich. The BA agent recommended this place, but really the only thing I found delightful here was the fact that there was a fresh episode of Top Gear on TV. As a former hotelier, I always like to think that hosts take pride in making the most of what;s available. I feel for the staff at this worn down and tired looking place. The bed had clean sheets but other than that, I don't think I regret leaving 83£ for such a poor performance on the part of the Travelodge brand. Id think with the Olympics around the corner, you can certainly give this place some investment sothat you wouldn;t have to be ashamed to put your name on the building. Or would you?

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again unless I was using the city airport.”
Reviews.Author: TBFH8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here simply because of the price on a theatre weekend break. We were booked into a disabled room & asked to change to a standard room but were told the hotel was full. After a discussion with the receptionist for half an hour we were changed to a standard room & given complementary breakfast which was basic to say the least with most items running out. The hotel is about a 10-15 min walk to the tube at city airport & I didn't hear any noise from the planes but due to the secluded location I would feel very uncomfortable about walking back late at night if I was alone. I saw that a couple of cars were broken into overnight & believe that it is a regular problem. The hotel was full of noisy children from a care home who were not properly supervised so had to change rooms again because of the noise. I also had a digital camera stolen from out of my room. Wouldn't stay again unless I had to fly out of city airport.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and worn but cheap”
Reviews.Author: julianlb
Reviews.Content: The only advantages this hotel has are that it is cheap and close to excel and the city airport. The room was tired, the bed knackered and the day that I was their the credit card machine was bust and the only way of paying was to draw cash from the expensive cash machine in reception. Not an entirely successful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: matt1958
Reviews.Content: Rooms excellent but restaurant poor and if the microwave broke down there would be none! Location great for City Airport and DLR but there is nothing else roundabout food wise. Clean room but choice of menu limited. Room service occasionally don't clear trays from room the next morning, however reception staff are good and deal with issues promptly If your using overnight to get to city airport, London Excel (walking distance) or indeed for the O2 then it is ideal place to stay. What lets it down is food and there is nowhere else nearby. I stayed long term while commutting into London City Airport during 2009-2010 during a contract and it was the quality of food service that eventually made me move no matter how convenient it was for my work.

Reviews.Title: “It`s Average Only Because of The Price”
Reviews.Author: tupelo70
Reviews.Content: This is a typical below average Travelodge, On the plus side are it`s price, cheap for London if you book in advance, it`s easy to find and get to,driving and DLR train.(a 5 min walk away). The downside, first Â£7.50 to park per night and big signs to say they accept no responsibility for the safety of your vehicle, no quick check-in due to "problems",typical Travelodge rooms and bathroom, nothing special.The TV had about 15 channels (I Think) but only 7 of them worked,2 of which had an annoying humming sound,when I asked about it,I was told that the repair man could find nothing wrong so had left it as it was ! On the night we choose to eat there, there were the first 4 items we ordered not available and the food we had was poor so we drove the following nights to find food, when it came to paying we couldn`t because the card reader was not working, so had to find a cash machine.It was a good job I didn`t want anything from the vending machine as this was not working either. The only reason it scored so high was the price. I was stuck here all week (pre Paid through work),and did not enjoy it,but for one night it would be acceptable (but ring Domino`s Pizza for Food)

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money but refurb required”
Reviews.Author: orientfan16
Reviews.Content: Booked the room on the Travelodge website 3 days before travelling. The cost was Â£29.95 per night - Bargain price for London. Getting to the hotel is easy, get off at Canning Town tube (Jubilee) and then get DLR towards Woolwich Arsenal. Get off at London City Airport and the hotel is a signposted 10 minute walk away. When I arrived there were two customers in front of me - one had no pillow, tea/coffee or spoons in their room, and the other had no pillows. Took 10 minutes to check in but the advisor was helpful. I requested a room on the top floor and the request was met. The corridor to the room was rather run down and smelly. I entered the room and was suprised - very clean and generally very good for the price I paid. The TV had 6 working channels, the radiator kept the room very warm, and the bathroom was again very clean and functionable. The view was the airport, and over the docks towards East London. I spotted West Ham United stadium in the distance along with what I think is the Olympics site. I slept very well, the bed was very comfortable. No noise heard over night, no traffic from outside and no idiots walking past the room at 5am! The shower had plenty of hot water, I purchased shampoo and shower gel from a shop 5 minutes walk away. In the morning there was a slight funny noise when planes landed and took off, but its not a problem as the airport is closed in the evening and the noise should not keep you awake. Did not try the food, but menus were in the room and there was a lot of choice. The lifts are a bit slow and run down as well, the lift on the left had two floor Ground buttons, one opens up to the waiting area while the other is the chambermaids area. Maybe a sign should be put up in the lift saying not to press the button that goes to the chambermaids area? So I would stay here again if the price is cheap, paying under Â£30 is amazing value but if I paid the "normal" rate of Â£69 I would feel that it would not be value for money. The corridors and rooms need a refurb though, paint was peeling off and carpet had holes, but for the price paid its not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy”
Reviews.Author: im76
Reviews.Content: Nothing impressive about this hotel. Feels much cheaper than the inflated prices you pay, and then there is an extra Â£8 surcharge for parking. Staff very unfriendly. Beds uncomfortable with very soft mattresse. Lighting in bathroom horrendous. We stayed here for one night when we came to the ExCel. Still hearing about it from the other half and what a bad choice it was. Do yourself a favour and pay the extra Â£30-40 and stay at the Aloft or one of the nicer hotels around ExCel

Reviews.Title: “Should have gone to a Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: devmangreen
Reviews.Content: First time in a Travelodge and I very much doubt I'd go back. Room was in bad need of redecoration, the matterass was lumpy, the pillows flat, the bathroom had a small bar of dodgy soap in it, and worst of all the walls were so thin that the guy snoring next door kept me awake for half the night.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Travelodge ideal for airport”
Reviews.Author: ReviewFerret
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel in walking distance of the airport terminal its ideal. I stayed here the night before any early flight and it was perfect. It takes 5-10mins to walk to the airport entrance. BUT, this is a standard Travelodge with average decor, a ropey restaurant/bar selling basic tastless food. If you want a base for visiting London, or a luxurious first night of your holidays before a flight then look elsewhere. If you want cheap and cheerful next to the airport its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay at hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missy J
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mum and sister for a week over the Christmas break as we wanted to just get away from home for the festive break. ROOM: We were allocated a big family room which was quite clean but it was on the ground floor next to the reception, a bit dark and with a view of bushes and factories. We knew the hotel was almost empty so we asked to be moved. The reception staff were accomodating and gave us a better room on the 5th floor with a spectacular view of the river and airport where you can see the planes taking off. Despite the airport being so close, there's hardly any noise. 5 stars for view. Room was clean, bed comfy and we had a pleasant stay. Small flatscreen tv available but some of the channels were scrambled. Plenty of towels were in the room upon arrival. Because it was very cold we asked for extra bedding and pillows and the staff were more than obliging. One of the lamps had no bulb but we never bothered to ask for a replacememnt because there were several lights in the room anyway. Tea and coffee facilities available in room. FOOD: We had booked inclusive dinner with an online discout, however the food wasn't that great, it seemed and tasted like frozen food that was microwaved. Dinner menu is reasonably priced but not very diverse. The beef rib and noodles are quite nice. On some nights the things we wanted from the menu were unavailable. Also due to using microwaves for cooking my mum's Indian nan bread accompanying her curry turned rock hard a few minutes after she got it. The breakfast is very basic scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and beans + cereals, yoghurt and muffins, but there was plenty of it. I would recommend eating out...or take away..its cheaper and probably better. Bad bits: The toilet was a little difficult to flush on day 5 but it wasn't too bad coz we were leaving the next morning but it made life a bit difficult as one had to fight with the handle for it to work. Two of the staff members were a bit moody but overall the staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was a bit sporadic maybe it was because of the Christmas break, don't know...but when the guys did it the bathroom wouldn't be very clean after they were done. The females were far better in terms of cleaning. Would I stay there again , most likely but if its luxury you're looking for this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “AWFULL !!!”
Reviews.Author: katy b
Reviews.Content: I travelled to this hotel on the 20th of decmeber for one night it was awfull !! When I arrived at the hotel they first said I had not paid for the room , later to find out I paid over a month ago via superbreak ! once we got into the room it was cold and damp, with stains on the bed sheets and hairs in the bath ! we stayed here to go to the 02 arena , it was in a good location to reach the hotel but that was the only plus side to the stay. then at 5am the cleaners had to hoover on in the hallway and were shouting to one another. would NEVER stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Typical travelodge, not bad, good for LCY”
Reviews.Author: Jeff-Vrieling
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because i had an early flight (755AM) out of LCY because of that and that i have stayed with the chain before, i booked this hotel, payed little over 50GBP for the room. the room was, as one could expect, nothing exciting and nothing wrong. Good beds (to my personal liking). and more importantly the room was clean. only used the bar to grab a couple of beers to the room to round up work, and they were decently priced as well. the only hint is that if you where going to visit the city for lea sure and not needing to be in this area don't stay here but at one of the others that they have. (due to potential noise from the airfield)

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: MrC1962
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Convenient for London city airport but that is it rubbish beer in bar rubbish food in cafe chef not in till seven and we not sure of kitchen what sort of national chain is this. It gives a very very bad impression of our country and I didn't even start on the room. Poor only one towel for two people and three pillows what is going on!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Typically Travelodge - Typical good value”
Reviews.Author: PeteDorset
Reviews.Content: Stayed at London City Airport Travelodge on the 30th November. Paid a little over Â£50 for the room and as usual with travelodge, no fuss, no hassles. The rooms are basic but warm clean and comfortable. For me i dont want anything else. I have no need for all the fuss and frills of more expensive hotels. I'm the sort of person who only comes to london occasionally, usually for gigs/concerts so just an overnight bed at a cheap price does it for me. Have never had an issue with Travelodge unlike some other hotel chains and i will continue to use them in future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff even under pressure”
Reviews.Author: visitor084
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Sun 20th after my flight was cancelled due to fog St city airport. The hotel and room were clean and comfortable. The staff here were very busy due to the flight cancellations but still remained calm, helpful and polite. Elaine on reception done a fantastic job even when faced with upset and angry customers who's flights ha just been cancelled. Some customers were very rude to her as they had to wait a long time to be checked in or served but what they should remember is that it wasn't her fault our flight was cancelled an it wasnt her fault that a line over about 100 of us had made our way to Travelodge all hoping to find a room. I felt very sorry for her and comended the way she stayed calm and help everyone she could. I herd people moaning about how long it was taking and that there should be more staff but come on guys Travelodge did not know our flights would be cancelled!! I paid for a clean room, hot breakfast and good service and that is exactly what I got.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Travelodge Stay”
Reviews.Author: AdzzzPhotography
Reviews.Content: Last minute stay, due to an event at Excel. You know what your getting with a Trvelodge, and thats exactly what you get here. Some of the communal areas are looking tired, but the room itself was a typical room, with a sofa. It was clean, basic, but ok for a single night to stay over and rest your head. Its befits are the closeness to London City Airport, Excel, (walking distance) & the O2 Arena. If your happy for a medicate stay at a not too expensive price, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Always serves”
Reviews.Author: vincentmark_davies
Reviews.Content: A return visit to this particular Travelodge, Ideal for us for a concert at The o2 all though a little further out than other hotels in Greenwich often a lot cheaper,its just a 10 minute drive or a Â£15 taxi journey to the venue if you are taking the car to The o2 pre-book car parking and save yourself Â£15. The hotel it's self is very typical of a Travelodge with the added bonus of very nice staff, rooms are a little tired but for what you pay they do the job,Breakfast was above the average all very fresh and plenty of it. We would not hesitate to use this hotel each and every time we attend The o2.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to offer”
Reviews.Author: Zach M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April this year, and i was unimpressed. not clean enough, they need to change the carpets in the hallway it is worn and ragged looking, the bathroom was clean though and i love the fact that a sofa was in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad For The Money”
Reviews.Author: bruciebonus_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year when visiting the O2 for the ATP tennis finals. Location wise can't fault, short walk to DLR although probably wouldn't fancy it if I was a lady on my own. Rooms are what you would expect and we had the breakfast organised as part of the deal. You can do this online and it makes sense to book it. Be careful with the parking in the hotel as it is organised by a third party. My advice would be to take a bag of pound coins if you are staying for a while. From memory i can't remember if it took credit cards. Hotel was busy on the Fri we stayed. Fortunately i wasn't on the floor with the loud music!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the o2 arena”
Reviews.Author: john k
Reviews.Content: stopped for 1 night 5/11/11 to go to a o2 arena show very easy to get from CANNING TOWN UNDERGROUND take the 474 from bus station drops right outside hotel same bus also goes direct to the city airport check in was quick the lady who checked us in was friendly helpful and informative room was basic but clean had a evening meal before we went to show had to wait 15 mins well worth the wait piping hot and delicious in the morning breakfast was ok enough variety to fell fairly full for a hotel to stay while visiting the o2 arena for value you can't go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Sofi B
Reviews.Content: I'm quite a big fan of Travelodge's as I know what to expect from them and the prices are usually very good so I tend to book with them a lot. This Travelodge however was slightly disappointing. The rooms were unclean compared to usual and the room we stayed in smelt revolting. The location itself was quite frustrating as we had a flight to catch from City Airport leaving at 9am. We thought the hotel was joint on to the airport or at least very close but it was actually more of a 15 minute walk away. Doesn't sound like far away but with suitcases it's a bit of a pain! We asked about taxi prices and the staff said it would cost at least Â£10 which seemed very expensive so we ended up walking to the airport at 6am. The staff also seemed very clueless, if you're needing information about the airport try check online before you get there. We needed the airports phone number and the hotel couldn't even provide that, i thought it would be commonly asked for being an airport hotel. One more thing, we arrived at 2.51 not realizing we were early and the desk staff member was quite rude, she said it was going to cost us Â£10 to check in. We found out check in was at 3 so stood there for 9 minutes waiting, she could have just said we were a few minutes early instead of immediately trying to charge us.. Tip: Try get this hotel for a cheap price if you're using it for the airport because the taxis are expensive. Otherwise you may aswell get a cheap b&b somewhere else and use the tube, least then you won't have to walk to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rank nasty place.”
Reviews.Author: Frankie M
Reviews.Content: It took 30 minutes for anyone to appear at the reception (by which time a queue was forming) even after ringing the bell on the desk. When people did appear they dealt with my inquiries with a look of distain. The room was grubby and the beds were unmade, I dare not mention the state of the bathroom either. When I went to meet some friends at breakfast a man who worked there ran up to me demanding something about breakfast -and due to a break down of communication it took me five minutes to explain that I was just meeting a couple of people. Five minutes later the same man eyed me suspiciously as I grabbed a plastic cup for a little water. Never felt so unwelcomed in a place in my life! This is only part of what I have to say for the london city airport travellodge, going on seems pointless and rage fueled. Still, I wouldn't reccommend it and the service is god damn terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful!”
Reviews.Author: kesfarnham
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights in this hotel on business, and on the second day I arrived back at the hotel at around 8.15pm and to my horror I'd left my purse back at the Excel and it was now shut. So I immediately went to the Receptionist, explained the situation, and asked if I could please put my evening meal on a tab against my room. She said "Oh no, sorry we don't do that". So I asked if I could phone a friend, get their card details, for them to take payment of my meal over the phone. She said "Oh no, sorry we don't do that". So I asked what my options were and she said "Sorry, none". So I retired to my room, alone, miles from home, with no food and no drink, sat down and cried! Thanks Travelodge for excellent customer service - NOT. I won't be booking my company or private accommodation with you ever again.

Reviews.Title: “â€œNO TWIN ROOMSâ€�”
Reviews.Author: marbel05
Reviews.Content: This hotel only has double bedded rooms, or family rooms, no twin bedded rooms, so for two single people, its either share a double bed or do as I did and sleep on the pull out bed, which you have to make up, after getting the bedding from reception - Why when you book twin beds and this is on invoice TWIN OCCUPANCY you think the bed would be made up. Had a room at front of hotel was basic, clean, but fairly dark and could do with some updating as with the rest of the hotel. The road outside did get very busy first thing in the morning, but the double glazing did a good job keeping the noise out. Breakfast was good but only scrambled egg as an egg option though. This hotel is in the middle of nowhere with no bars, pubs or restaurants close by and is on the north side of the DLR and nearest station is City Airport (rather than Pontoon Dock) a good 1 km walk along the pavement of the road on south side of DLR, but, the 474 bus does stop right outside the hotel from both stations. This hotel also seems to be used by a lot of business travellers and workmen in the area. We went to the 02 for a concert and was advised to take the 474 bus to Canning Town from right outside the hotel and then get the DLR to North Greenwich for O2 which was quite straight forward.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: gales72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst attending Peter Kay's tour at the 02 in June. It is well located for the City Airport, and the transport links are great to the 02 and into town. The hotel appears modern from the outside, but it is already looking tired on the inside. The staff were very friendly, check in was fairly smooth - neither of the automatic check in machines were working, but the wait wasn't too bad. The room was dissapointing, very sparse and clinical. It doesn't generate any kind of atmosphere - certainly not a destination for a romantic break! The bed linen was clean, but there was no mattress protector, just a flimsy sheet. The noise is not too bad, we were on the side of the hotel adjacent to the DLR, but it never really bothered us. Breakfast was adequate but nothing special, the ingredients appeared cheap. The breakfast staff were not that adept at cleaning tables, just smearing the dirt round a bit - much to the disgust of some foreign tourists staying at the hotel - who attempted to take the staff to task about the standard, but without much luck. I don't think I would rush to come back to this hotel, but it is convenient for the airport and good links to the 02 and ExCEL. I read alot of reviews after I had booked the hotel and would like to add my comments to some of the issues mentioned on other reviews. Firstly, proximity to the airport. The hotel is very close to the airport and with just hand luggage to carry is an easy walk. With suitcases it would not be recommended - better to catch a bus or get a taxi - it is only a 10 min walk, but not ideal if you have a heavy suitcase in tow - but anyone who says that the hotel is not convenient for the aiport is clearly incorrect - you couldn't get much closer without building it on the runway! Safety walking at night - we walked back to the hotel from the DLR station at the Airport, at around midnight and felt safe, there is good lighting and we didn't encounter anyone during our walk back - there is still some traffic around which helps to the feeling of safety. Security of Car Park - this was my biggest concern after reading the reviews, but I suspect that the worst of this issue is over as we didn't witness any cars having been broken into. I'll admit that I followed some good advice that I read in here, locking the sat nav in the boot and using a wipe to erase the tell tale ring on the windscreen. However I think that this is fairly sensible whenever you are unsure about the area you are parking in. In summary this is a cheap hotel to crash in if you are using the airport, attending an event at 02 or Excel. It is basic and functional, the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: Flois
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here for a function at the Excel centre - just the job. I walked over the footbridge from the Excel and back again, and used Prince Regent station. I had a room on the third floor which was ideal (opt for at least one floor up if you can rather than basement or ground floor and you can open the window fully) There was a lovely view over the water and the airport. No noise though and I had a really good night's sleep. I paid Â£89 for the night even though the area was packed and rooms at a premium. I can't comment on the breakfast as i didn't bother with it choosing instead to have a coffee from the bar and picked up some food on the way home.

Reviews.Title: “City Airport”
Reviews.Author: Truffles21122010
Reviews.Content: Travelodge City Airport is an exellent hotel - 2009 it was two years old. Rooms approx 20 m2 +++ - good bed, very nice staff, 300 m from the airport, exciting breakfastroom - seeing the airplanes taking off and landing. Windows was treble of four-glased, so I heard nothing from the planes and - a surprise : nothing from DLR either. Lived on 2nd floor with DLR right in front of my window . For me a new Ldn-area to explore (being used to West End, which turns out to be boring after some time there), by foot, by bus and by DLR. I can recommend the hotel and wish you all good luck in the East of London !!

Reviews.Title: “standard but noisy and awful bed”
Reviews.Author: neil r
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews, I feared the hotel would be dirty. It was not. The room was clean and looked reasonable, but the mattress had seen better days -or at least if it hadn't, it had no right to be a mattress. It dipped in the middle and I spent the night clinging to the side. Also, the hotel appears to be built pretty well on the runway of the airport. Convenient, but terrifying when planes come past the window. They're so close, you feel it's 'Hotel 9 11'. Not restful. The staff were pleasant and helpful, and at Â£79 a night it was the cheapest I could find in london - which is an absurd state of affairs in itself. Not the worst experience by any stretch, but check the mattress first.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return if they offered it free”
Reviews.Author: LemurLes
Reviews.Content: Hotel frontage is the usual Travelodge setup, but room we had was like a monk's cell. OK it was cheap, but walls were badly scuffed and marked, bedlinen was stained and smelled musty. Shower room had mould in many places, and falling apart at the edges. Lighting was dingy, as if to hide all the defects. Room was just a few yards away from the DLR railway which ran until 1am, and started at 5am, and there was no effective soundproofing. While cheap, it was an expensive way to stay awake all night. Plus points were friendly staff, and it is close to London City Airport, our destination, [but we'd have been better leaving home in the early hours and driving direct to the airport].

Reviews.Title: “Room not cleaned, poor service at reception. Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Bombadil77
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but the room had not been cleaned with half empty bottles and wash cream in the shower. When I complained the girl on reception said she would speak with the manager but when I returned later she had not done so To be honest I expected a refund but was only told that it was unnaceptable. Would not go back again

Reviews.Title: “Useful place to stay if you have an early flight”
Reviews.Author: L-Man77
Reviews.Content: Nice little Travelodge,conveniently located half a mile from London City Airport.It's also not at all far from the O2(Millenium Dome)Arena. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the bar was pleasant and served late night snacks. The room was adequate just like all Travelodges and we got a good rate as we booked in advance. The airport is a very short bus journey (bus stop right outside hotel) or a 10 minute walk. It's also a 10 minute walk from the DLR station. Nothing but an Esso garage nearby so come prepared.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel cheap and great base for london”
Reviews.Author: stuart d
Reviews.Content: What a nice travel lodge stayed here as was going to see a west end show and the price was good , got here and thought good loads of planes and loads of noise. Went to room and was in plane spotters heaven donâ€™t be put off by noise as when you shut the windows you canâ€™t hear any noise at all and as the planes do not fly at night a good nightâ€™s sleep first class , the dlr is only a couple of minutes walk away that is if you are fit if not loads of taxis outside , we stayed here for two days the only problem was the breakfast on the second day the staff where late opening up and did not turn the machines on and best of all the mess on the tables and on the floor was from last nightâ€™s customers , if you stay here and want to see London in a different way go to Woolwich arsenal by dlr our the free ferry and get on the London Thames clipper boat great and cheap way to see London by the river

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for London City flights”
Reviews.Author: FlightCommander
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to our flight to Majorca, thus avoiding travelling across London in the early morning rush hour. Hotel is well located at the end of the runway and is a straightforward walk (say 0.5 miles max) to/from the airport/DLR station. There is also a bus stop right outside and a regular bus (474) which goes to the airport. The hotel is a pretty standard Travelodge with all the basics. Room was fine, quiet and clean. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We also went out for dinner to Canary Wharf using the DLR from the airport to Canning Town and then taking the Jubilee Line to Canary Wharf which was very straightforward. Canary Wharf offers good shops and lots of good eateries. Overall, will stay there again if flying from LCY.

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing but OK”
Reviews.Author: UkAnnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights as going to a concert at the o2 and needed somewhere with a car park to leave car. Location was fine for us, although it should be noted there isn't really anything around it except a petrol station with shop a short walk away. It was a little noisy with people coming and going late/early as next to London City airport. Main negative is the awful beds Travelodge provide...really really soft, no mattress protector and the one pillow you get each. ..very inferior to their main rival whose beds and pillows are excellent. For what we paid on the outskirts of London it was fine and as long as you don't expect too much it will suit you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location!”
Reviews.Author: AmieOldham
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for an event at the O2 arena as it was the cheapest hotel to it. The location was ideal as it wasnt to far and for 12 of us to stay was the perfect price. The staff were very friendly even after we got a bit rowdy in the bar the first night. The food in there is great value for money i would recommend the pizzas as we shared one between 2 of us! Not very much around the hotel but for us was great. The rooms were very clean and the beds were changed both days.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job - a cheap night within reach of the city”
Reviews.Author: Cronslow
Reviews.Content: Picked this room up for Â£10 - the car parking was near;y as much but we needed to be within striking distance of Canary Wharf on the Monday morning. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet - no night flights from the very nearby airport. The food was what you might expect at the price - high on calories but low on flavour. Service was variable - the first contact was sullen but later the staff were very helpful - extra towels etc. were not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - makes me wary of the chain”
Reviews.Author: gill.e
Reviews.Content: The loo seat was beside the loo. How could you allocate a room with a fault like that? The shower leaked out of the shower tray onto the floor. The cleanliness was poor. Other residents were trying to change rooms when we arrived. Would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient place for London City Airport”
Reviews.Author: chris_green100
Reviews.Content: Easy and convenient place to stay for London City Airport. Easy automated check in process if you've pre booked. You can still interact with a human if you so wish. Very clean with great double glazing that you wouldn't know you are right beside the airport and a DLR line. Car parking very cheap for near an airport. I didn't drive but did notice it was only in the region of Â£5 per day. Though the hotel isn't right by the terminal building, there are bus stops right outside the hotel which makes it easier travelling between the Airport terminal and the hotel especially with luggage. Only one stop Not a location for a tourist visiting London, but great for people, business or family using the airport or business people wanting to keep costs down and working in Canary Wharf or Bank / Morgate area of London..

Reviews.Title: “Didn't end up staying here due to the man in our bed!”
Reviews.Author: x--NIKKINOO--x
Reviews.Content: I would say I stayed here the other night.. But we arrived late (as we were told was okay) and she said there was one room left, she gave us the key we found the room, walked in and there was a man in the bed, undressed!!! Went back down to inform the lady at reception, turned out they had no rooms left and hadnt realised! Had to get in an hour long taxi to Kingston! Got there for 5.30am and then had to travel back to London city centre the next day, I booked to stay there for a reason! They paid my taxi to Kingston but not a return journey! It also meant I had to wake up an hour earlier to travel back. I booked this hotel because its where I wanted to stay - otherwise I would have booked a different one wouldnt I! Why rent a room then let someone else have it, if you have 60 rooms then only book that many up!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, functional, not the worst”
Reviews.Author: KennethTan
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is located within between Pontoon Dock DLR and London City Airport DLR, both about 10 -- 15 min walk away. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel, making it very convenient if you have a lot of luggage, or if it is raining. The hotel is quiet. I don't hear the airport traffic noise at all. Room: The room is simple and bathroom is clean. The carpet is looking used, and parts showing signs of having been dirtied. The bed is not bad. I tried to get them to change the bedsheets one day, but they didn't appear to have done so when I got back. One day, I was left without towels, but the staff got me a few towels quite quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Â£198.00 for NO ROOM on arrival!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: claire261180
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid for 2 rooms for 1 night, advised would be arriving late, approx 11pm and informed this was fine. Spent 4 hours driving and on arrival waited 20 minutes to be served and then the girl disappeared for nearly 10 minutes and a guy, Victor, came back, he spent approx 10 minutes faffing with the computer system and eventually informed us there was 1 room, but it was a family room. What good this was is still a mystery. He then said he would book 1 room in a different Travelodge, again, this was of no use as we were here on business. Keep in mind it is already late and time is going by now. After a further 15 minutes we were informed Islington had rooms for us. 5 minutes later we were asked if we minded sharing a taxi, which we didnt as the chap seemed ok. After finally arriving at Islington the receptionist informed the 3 of us there was only 2 rooms available!! The single guy booked in and we were again left with 1 room, and this time no car to go elsewhere. After approx 20 minutes of the receptionist faffing with his computer, and the single guy disappearing we were given 2 room keys, yes, they magically made a room appear! Yes, we finally got our rooms, but neither was of a satisfactory standard, and the bed was the worst I have ever seen and felt like a heard, yes a heard of elephants had jumped on it all its life. I could keep going on, but I think you have the jist that you should really AVOID this Travelodge, even if it is the only accomadation left in London DO NOT STAY AT EITHER!!!! Oh, and the Â£50 "compensation to my account" is a total insult and I am currently awaiting a responce.....

Reviews.Title: “Awful, never again!”
Reviews.Author: nechtangel
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room for me and my friend, ended up sharing a double bed for 3 nights! Rooms too hot, rather pungent and bathroom not up to scratch. No hairdryer in room either. Restaurant was not good. Service awful (constantly had to wait at the bar for 15+ minutes to be served as not enough staff on), breakfast was a complete shambles (i ended up having to eat beans on toast with a spoon!). Really would not stay here again, and believe me I'm not a fussy traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Do I have to stay here again ?”
Reviews.Author: n4dave
Reviews.Content: Hmmm so I purchased an advanced cheap room for me in June and another in August for 3 of us wish I could get a refund now . The rooms are small , noisy and really smell , they need RENOVATION now !!!!! You have self service machines to book in to get your key , these were not working and I had to wait 3-4 mins to get someone to the front desk ! Beds are soft and can't really sleep very well , rooms are small and very very basic guess thats what you expect for the price. You need to pay extra for wifi .. most hotels provide this for free FOOD .,.. The menu is cheap but the food is microwaved so don't have the (tinned) soup as the roll is rock hard ... I alsp had pie and chips with veg and the poor veg were nuked ! Breakfast ... water made scrambled eggs , cold bacon , few rolls so won't have that again. Not very good hotel even though you can get rooms from Â£29 ... still not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Basic!”
Reviews.Author: ParsifalLondon
Reviews.Content: clean but that's about all i can say good about it. no airconditioning, very uncomfortable night. rude restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in history”
Reviews.Author: vickyforry84
Reviews.Content: arrived late at night no bedding for the children they had to sleep together , staff was rude and wouldnt give us change 4 vending machine, was rudly told no we couldnt have an iron was given a high chair that the wooden leg was litteraly snapped in half , breakfst was cold half was missin no cups or cutlery, really rude staff i have never been spoken to so rudly by all the hotel staff serious attitude problem and it wasnt just us other people had the same problem DO NOT STAY HEAR it was HORRENDOUS

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is!”
Reviews.Author: NJHTaunton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Friday night as we were going to an event at the O2 which is only about 15mins away on the DLR. The nearest tube station is London City Airport which is about a 10min walk away. It's not in the prettiest of areas but to be fair we didn't go for the views! The hotel itself has quite nice public area, it's all very functional of course with vending machines for snacks/drinks and a computer & printer in reception. Our room was on the 3rd floor, basic of course but again functional. The bed had seen better days though and there was definite roll together! That said I would stay here again if I needed to be in that area and just needed somewhere to lay my head

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: karen186451
Reviews.Content: Family of 6 stayed here for a couple of nights over the bank holiday. Late check in as we had been sight seeing and even though the rooms were on different floors staff were able to change so we were next to each other (i just dont get travelodge who think rooms booked in same names, paid with same card should be on separate floors!) Rooms usual standard, ours were clean and adequate bedding. good secondary glazing stopping DLR noise well. Planes stop around 10 or so at night and first I heard was 6.30 am so no problems there. Breakfast nicely cooked, staff helpful. despite other reviews saying a 'scary' walk from DLR ive no problems as just 10 mins max down a street lit road. good crossings, so no idea what the problem is for other people. Happy to stay here again, good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I need for a business stopover”
Reviews.Author: Quinbus
Reviews.Content: OK, it's basic, no-frills in typically Travelodge style but it has everything that I want from a hotel when all I'm going to do is sleep there. Close to the Excel exhibition centre, the room was big with a large desk and convenient power-points, bathroom very clean, bed comfortable, and hefty double-glazing making it surprisingly quiet even though I could see the runway outside the window. Decent pubgrub in the bar (the most expensive dish is Â£7.95), and a passable house wine (Chilean). What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, rooms were very quite even though you can see the runway from your room”
Reviews.Author: visitor084
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the evening before the royal wedding. I must say the staff and decorations really had us buzzing and in the mood for the event. We joined in with the raffle and childrens colouring competition the staff were as excited as we were about the upcoming event. The room was clean and comfortable with enough bedding for my family, did have to ask for extra towel as only 2 provided in the room. When I enquired at reception I was informed that 2 towels are standard anymore needs asking for but was given straight away. The food was nice I was told it was a new menu for the summer and choice was good. I have stayed here before and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I got a good price.”
Reviews.Author: TelfordSteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with the wife because we were at a show at EXCELL just a mile down the road. The main reaon for staying here was the price as I'd seen a Â£15 a night room offer courtesy of the money saving expert website. When you add breakfast on X2 (another Â£13) and then having to pay for parking at Â£5 it probably wasn't such a good deal. The noise from the airport is somethng else and the walk from the nearest DLR station (London city airport) late at night is a little bit scary even for me who is also a little bit scary. For the extra money knowing what I Know now I would have stayed at the Premier Inn down the road who may be dearer, but I've never stayed in a bad one. Oh, and it's true about the beds here, they're as soft as anything and you both end up rolling into the middle unable to roll apart again.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: MusicMaestro95
Reviews.Content: First warning sign was the need to walk with no obvious signing from LCY to guide new visitors ton the hotel. At check in we requested two front facing rooms (facing away from the DLR which runs right at the back of the hotel.) Both rooms allocated were at track level,facing the DLR. Rooms are probably the most basic of any budget hotel we have stayed in across the world; let alone the UK. The mattress was clearly well past it's sell by date and the most uncomfortable slept on since our last visit to another Travelodge in the north of the UK. There seemed to be no soundproofing here meaning that the sounds of the DLR and flights were more than intrusive - making this unworthy of being called an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE, GOOD TRANSPORT LINKS and QUIET”
Reviews.Author: Wiltshiregirl42
Reviews.Content: Only one point to BEWARE of even if your paperwork say different - check in is not until 1500 ( on the dot ), anytime before is a charge of Â£10. We had room 501 was right opposite the runway - it was extremely quiet, no noise atall from either inside or outside the hotel. Transport links were good, initially we took the DLR to London City Airport and it was a 10min walk. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel Red Bus Number 474 takes you either to Canning Town direction for DLR, or to the City airport. We also walked to Pontoon Dock DLR station, again about 10 mins but quite easy. Good cooked breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about its location”
Reviews.Author: Trev123
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel that is reasonably priced. Simple basic rooms which will not spoil you but are clean and comfortable. No twin rooms so difficult if you want to share a room, although a family room can be booked and a second person can use the bed settee. Take your own shower gel and soap as none are provided. Checking-in helped by clever vending machine which you input your booking details. Discount if you pre-pay breakfast. Buffet breakfast acceptable for the price with a choice of cereals, croissants, and the ubiquitous full english- scrambled eggs only. Good position for the ExCel exhibition centre being a 10 minute walk away. Convenient for London City Airport DLR station, again only 10 mins walk, however poor signage outside the station doesn't help you find your way. Bar ok with reasonable prices. Food available, but of the chicken-ping variety only really good for keeping body and sole together until you find something better, which is very difficult. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere with no bars, pubs or restaurants close buy, which is a big disappointment .

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people say, really!!”
Reviews.Author: spencer226
Reviews.Content: We had to be in London for my daughter to attend a job interview in central London early on Monday morning 28/2/11. as she had her young daughter with her, Mom and Dad were driver and nanny for the trip. With luggage, car seat, buggie etc, we needed to have the car with us so we decided on London City Airport Travelodge as it had parking outside. We booked 2 rooms at a good rate, we arrived on Sunday evening, Stephanie from Brittany was on reception,lovely girl, having booked online we had our rooms in just a couple of minutes, both family rooms on the 3rd floor rear, they were clean, warm and everything you would expect from a Travelodge, no problems. whilst my daughter got our grandaughter to sleep, my wife and I went to the bar/cafe to eat. Stephanie who was very pleasant and happy at all times was serving in the bar and took our order which was a Combo for two and taking the advice of another report on this site 2 bowls of chips!! I had a pint of Stella which was served perfectly in a Stella glass, Â£3-30 (London prices). The cafe was busy and there was a good atmosphere, the food arrived in about 10 minutes and was really nice, the chips were perfect, dry and crisp. we could have ate more!! the meal was a reasonable Â£10 for the 2 of us, no complaints at all. Up early the next morning to escort my daughter to the DLR at Pontoon Bridge about 10 minutes walk away, (Â£10 for the return ticket into central London be warned) yes the area is a bit cold and industrial, but on the way back there is an ON THE RUN service station which has a small cafe and they do the best take out bacon/sausage/egg baps, really nice and a morning newspaper. They are open 24/7 and breakfast starts at 5am!! The reason we stopped at this Travelodge was the car parking, which costs Â£5 for overnight parking and YES that do have people come around and check you have a ticket!!! be careful!! We found all the staff most pleasant, but having a 3 month old baby with you rather changes peoples attitudes, I think!! The room cleaning staff we met we young Asian lads and they could not be more helpful for pillows towels, etc, as I said you could not fault the rooms which we large and they were excellent for our needs. Finally I know that this site is monitored by Travelodge Head Office, could I say thank you to Marc in the Customer Service Team for the way he dealt with my mistake in booking the wrong date for one of our nights stay in London, he sorted it out and provided a voucher which I can use again with Travelodge soon. I know there are some comments about poor service, but having got contact via E mail with Marc, the problem was sorted out in a couple of minutes to my satisfaction, so well done Marc, from another happy customer. Overall we had a very good stay at the Travelodge London City Airport, ask for a room at the back of the hotel away from the plane noise and you will not hear a thing, promise. From the third floor we had a great view of the Thames Barrier which I had never seen close up before quite impressive. P.S. Daughter got a job offer so it was all worth it !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “average budget hotel, out of the way be prepared to walk”
Reviews.Author: travellondon165
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights, by the second night we found the nearest rail was pontoon dock which was still a fair walk away and was not really enjoyable late at night, however the rooms were clean and the breakfast was impressive. most of the staff were rude and ignorant and did not seem willing to go out of their way to help. next visit to London we won't be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay-one of many for value venue outside the city”
Reviews.Author: travelightman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this lodge quite a few times now and find it very good value and offers good clean accommodation in the docklands area outside the city. A short tube/DLR ride (get an oyster card/tube day pass for best value). The Lodge is a short 10 -12minute walk back along the road from the City Airport (go under the road using the underpass) and is just before the airport stop (look left as you are approaching the stop). Its not signposted so you may need to ask at the stop. Never had cause for any hotel complaint -quite the reverse (& Im a seasoned Travelodge guest). The buffet breakfast is always enjoyable. To say it's opposite the airport runway start it's soundproofing is very good. Carparking is very adequate at the hote (but chargeable). Those staying the first time may need to ask for directions back along the road which runs underneath the elevated railway. Allow a good 30 minutes on the train from central London. No close eating but reasonably priced food/drinks served at the hotel. Expensive wifi is my only complaint (in all Lodges)!

Reviews.Title: “Set a new low for a budget hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: EstTravellers60
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for the London boat show for the last 5 yrs and watched it gradually slide from bad to worse. This year it stooped to a new low with no extra pillows, no extra towels, 1 1/2 hour wait for food and then running out of cooked breakfast 1 3/4 hours before the end of breakfast time. It is getting very grotty very stained carpets poor room cleaning and service. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, an absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: Richy-UK_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is some way out of the centre of London. If you're using the airport, it's ideal. However if you are planning to use this hotel for a visit to central London, then a little planning goes a long way! I was staying here to visit an event in east London - a little distance away. I'd done the research in terms of transport links (DLR and 24 hour bus stops right outside the hotel) and what's nearby (not a lot), and had no problems whatsoever. Just be careful if you stay here without doing some planning, you may be surprised! To say the hotel is next to the airport and has a DLR line going right past, it was remarkably quiet. I was given a 1st floor room which faced the DLR line. Typical large Travelodge room with a big bed and a decent shower. The window was triple glazed, to isolate the noise. In my room, I did not hear a single plane taking off or landing. I did hear the DLR going past, but it was quieter than a car going past my house at night, so it didn't bother me. I booked early during a sale, and got a four night stay for an average of under Â£30 per night. At this price, I got amazing value for money! The hotel was clean, the bed was comfy and the shower was hot and powerful. I didn't eat in the hotel, but did use the bar and the prices for beer and snacks were reasonable considering the location. Here's a tip for food, there's a nice little cafe in Thames Barrier Park within ten minutes walk from the hotel, serving good snacks and light lunches. No problems whatsoever, and extremely pleased with this hotel for the price. If I'm in the area again, I will certainly consider staying here again. Well done Travelodge!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: thomasmolloy
Reviews.Content: This is quite a new Travelodge, and appears generally well-kept. Communal areas are a little worn, but clean. The room was larger than standard, also clean and comfy. The only issue was the speed of shower and sink drainage - the shower would overflow if you had a long shower and didn't pay attention. Location great for driving, 5-8 minute walk to the Docklands Light Railway (not ideal but not a big deal either)

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I feared”
Reviews.Author: ISFLM
Reviews.Content: Had an early flight from London City, so wanted to stay close by so I didn't have to get up at ungodly o'clock. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from London City, and pretty easy to find. I'd booked well in advance, and got a room/dinner/breakfast deal for less than Â£40, so wasn't expecting much. After arriving, I had a quick look round the area. It's a bit of a wasteland. If I could have found somewhere other than the hotel to eat (even though I'd already paid Â£6 for dinner) and somewhere other than the hotel bar to drink, I'd have preferred that. However, couldn't find anywhere. So.. Reception was friendly and efficient. The room was clean and functional - only the barest of necessities, but did have coffee making facilities and TV. The bar/restaurant area are typical modern/low budget - short on atmosphere, but perfectly serviceable. Much to my surprise, given the lack of local competition, beer cost no more than in my local (which is cheap at Â£2.60/pint). The meal was the OK side of average - what do you expect for Â£6? - although the chips are highly recommended. The only downside to my stay was that it turns out they don't start serving breakfast till 7:00 - they either don't say that on the web site or I missed it - so my prepayment for breakfast was wasted as I had to leave at 6:45. All in all, though, a pleasant surprise - and recommended for anyone who, like me, needs to be close to London City Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there, will go there again”
Reviews.Author: Cozmic-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Been before and service was the same as last time. Which was better then some people would say. Will be going back there again next year. Room was clean, food was ok, check in was quick. Only problem I had was with the pillows, again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at a Place THAT DOES NOT SUPPLY SHAMPOO!”
Reviews.Author: otissito
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but this place is worse than expected. For 66 BPS (Pound or $100.00 USA), you expect the Motel to at least supply shampoo and a telephone in the room! Come on!!! If you don't do that, it tells me Travelodge does not care about making a customer comfortable. When a business does this, why should you book your room there. Listen, you want convenience for a local hotel at an airport, but you also want RESPECT! What do they think? Customers don't wash their hair! Horrible, Try the Etap Hotel near by. I haven't, but I bet you they supply shampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Stay”
Reviews.Author: Simps82
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid week towards the end of may, Hotel was ok. Bed for a night wasn't the cosiest but provided a low cost bed for the night. Breakfast was ok, no hot drink available which was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good value (if you get cheap rates)”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamJollyBoy
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable rates for the location. Everything you'd expect from a TravelOdge. Unfortunately a coach load of Dutch tourists and a couple of staff absences caused some breakfast chaos but the staff did their best. The staff were generally friendly although one member of staff was a bit disbelieving that a 15 year old was a under 16. It can be noisy if your room is next to the Docklands Light Railway.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamVillafan
Reviews.Content: if travelling with suitcases by tube it is easier to buy a day travelcard(Â£6.30) travel to canning town get a bus to the hotel it stops right outside and runs 24hrs. the hotel is clean but can not cope with breakfast it runs out of everything and you have to keep asking for things. we had a problem with chairs five of us but only tables for four we borrowed a chair from other empty tables but then they had to get a chair from another table we felt uncomfortable because people were looking at us for chairs.overall we got what we paid for but would stay again if we were on a limited budget,

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgigi
Reviews.Content: this is possibly the nearest thing to an open prison I have ever come across. if you plan to stay here because of its closness to the airport - DONT! Just go a day early to where you are off to and pay for an extra night there. It is VERY basic and charges for anything it can get away with - it ought to be run by Ryanair. They charge for booking in before 3 You can't leave luggage but you can't book in either there is NO SOAP AT ALL in the room My only advice to anyone stuck here is to get a cab to The Gun in nearby Blackwell tunnel area and enjoy that. I will never return here - awful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: adrianhobson
Reviews.Content: At Â£49 this was good value for a business trip to Canary Wharf. It was a fairly convenient location - about 10 mins and 3 stops to Westferry. There is some inconvenience in staying further out but the savings were significant. Staff were friendly and service in the Cafe was prompt. 2 courses for Â£6 were fair value and the Â£6.60 breakfast was OK. The staff member looking after breakfast was very cheerful. Big screen TV in cafe bar helped while away a bit of time. Not much to occupy you in the near vicinity. Room facilities basic but you do get tea and coffee. Bed a bit soft but bathroom OK. Room could be cheered up a bit with a few pictures. Walk from the DLR isn't too bad. Probably best to leave by the airport exit and not the DLR subway. Walk along on the higher level perimeter roadrather than through the residential estate. Takes about 5 mins. No need for a bus unless you're less able to walk. Hotel is outside congestion zone and charges for parking. Nice view of runway and departing aircraft if you're interested in planes. Quite noisy but fortunately the airport shuts down at night. I'd seriously think about staying here for a low cost visit to central London especially when rates are low. A bit inconvenient but costs the same on the tube/DLR and you coudl save a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “a really cheap and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: tartan-crystal
Reviews.Content: i read a few reviews on this hotel, and to be very honest the bad reviews about this hotel are a load of rubbish... my wife and i stayed there 1 night for our anniversary, costing Â£29 for a room without breakfast, and we had no problems, the staff were very friendly and polite, the room was spotless, we went down for our dinner which was brilliant, Â£16 for 2 meals and drinks. this is a fantastic hotel although a little out the way and only a 5min walk from the dlr station it was not a problem for us.. if you are looking for a great hotel to stay in overnight then this is the one to goto... top marks all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner, bed, breakfast at a London airport, for just Â£26.50 per person!”
Reviews.Author: sussexperson
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£29 for two people in a family room and our stay was absolutely perfect. The dinners are like a microwave meal you might have at home but what can one expect for Â£6 in London? The huge breakfast buffet is absolutely wonderful value at Â£6, only one tiny niggle - we would prefer fried eggs to scrambled. The dining room is chic and stylish and through the huge windows you can watch planes taking off and landing! The rooms are great, kingsize bed, sofa, tv, teamaking, ensuite with bath and shower. Spotlessly clean, great lighting and relaxing, neutral decor. Dinner, bed, breakfast at a London airport, for just Â£26.50 per person? It's just silly money! We stayed here to catch an early flight at 9am. We've already booked up to stay here again in June.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far out but not as bad some people have said”
Reviews.Author: Cozmic-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I've read some really bad reviews on here about this Travelodge, but with some of the things written about the Docklands Travelodge I have to say again, were they staying in the same hotels as me? It's a Travelodge, not the Savoy. You're not going to get 5 star hotel but you do get a good service for what you pay. I found the staff helpful, and let me know about having to recheck-in each morning (Booked Saver Rate rooms so made multiple 1 night stays) which wasn't a problem for us. The room clean and tidy. And we could barely hear planes taking off or landing, or even the DLR that ran behind the hotel. Could hear the late night buses that ran past but wasn't really that annoying. The breakfast was fine, though it did get really busy on the Saturday. They could really do with a bigger space. We did stay in one of the evening and ate in, ordered some burgers and chips which we was allowed to take to our room and was really tasty and filling, which I was surprised with tbh, My only problems I did have was the pillows where a bit uncomfortable, but I got use to them on the second night. Also, even though they had great transport running to that area (Well TfL did have a lot of Line Closes that weekend but not enough to make it impossible to get to and from the hotel, what was running was on time and ran regularly) I have to say it did feel like we was in the middle of nowhere, with little to do for couples. And tbh again, the area did look a bit rough but it was really quiet and saw no trouble at all. Didn't see any cars broken into in the car park either. This hotel is really good if you're using the Airport or going to shows at the O2 or even if you're going to Excel. But if you're really there to visit the city, then it's best you go to one of the other Tarvelodges in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Good base but beware tube work at weekends”
Reviews.Author: Wotnohair
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful hotel. It's a Travel lodege so not sure why some people expect four star service. Rooms clean, good breakfast and very quiet at weekends as no traffic passing unlike other travel lodges. The only downside is that you need to plan your stay around tube maintenance or else you can get stranded. Check TFL online and you'll have a cracking cheap stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “A PLACE TO REST YOUR HEAD - AND THAT'S IT”
Reviews.Author: londonlady2
Reviews.Content: Very, very basic hotel - of our party, none of us had remotes for the tv's (they'd all been stolen apparently) only one of us had a bath plug and no-one had more than one towel per person (and these varied in size) Overworked staff couldn't help (I kept hearing 'we don't offer room service' - I only wanted a plug brought up for goodness sake!). The proximity to the airport meant the soundproofing was good and I slept surprisingly well (perhaps I was exhausted having worked at the exhibiton at nearby ExCel for the day). Breakfast usual Travelodge bland offering (all heated up in microwaves, no fresh cooking) but it fills a gap. The hotel was full so they rushed you through b/fast so they could serve everyone which led to indigestion a couple of days. Didn't use the carpark so couldn't comment - BEWARE taxi charges. If the hotel books you one the cost is 30-50% MORE than if you call yourself. The usual charge to the ExCel centre was Â£10 yet when I called myself it ws only Â£6! Price was high (it was a popular exhibition and so they could charge what they liked) - yes I'd use it for business again (having made sure I asked in advance to make sure all 'amenities' like bath plugs, towels etc were in the room!) but never for myself

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: visitor084
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel I was a concerned that I had booked into crime capital of the world. I can honestly say I do not understand what others are talking about. I parked my car in the car park for 4 nights and not 1 car was broken into, they had plenty of security camera's in the car park and it was well lit. I found all of the staff to be friendly and they could not do enough to help, even giving us clear written directions to where we wanted to go into london, even details like what bus stand to go to! I dod not eat an evening meal there but while I was drinking in the bar area it looked good and the people eating had no complaints. Breakfast was really good value for money I booked this online to get a discount, it was very hot and lots available for Â£5.99 you can't go wrong and I am led to believe that child eat free. The rooms was very clean and spacious with everything you need. Even though the hotel is very close to the airport runway and railway station you can not hear this noise from the rooms due to triple glazing effects. The car aprk does cost Â£5 per day and you can leave your car there for longer if you are going out on the day you leave, although the hotel has not got enough change to give everyone that stays, you can call and pay over the phone. I herd a few people moaning about this but come on do you really expect the hotel to wipe your bottom for you? I will definatly stay here again and recommed to all of my firend. Great location, great staff and great value for money. Thank you Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Book early to grab a bargain room”
Reviews.Author: PrestonTraveller
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I have stayed at a Travelodge after bagging on of their sale offers almost four months ago. A family room for Â£19.00. An extra Â£5.99 per person for breakfast (with 20% online booking discount and kids eat free). We had a long journey to London interrupted by traffic hold ups, so we were never in any danger in arriving before the official check in time. The hotel was easy to find, I just put City airport on the sat nav. The hotel is literally yards away from the airport. There are a few other hotels in the vicinity such as a Premier Inn Etap hotel and Ramada. There is a daily Â£5 charge for all day hotel parking so have some coins handy but you can also pay by credit card via your mobile phone. Previous reviews have mentioned car park security problems. It might had been an issue in the summer where daybreak is early. During my stay it was dark until about 8:00 am and got dark again at 4:00 pm and it was sub zero temperature at nights. I did park near reception and I also notice there were CCTV cameras around the car park. However I also believe that parking near reception is a false sense of security as I think that reception is not manned during the night and after 11:00 pm you have to use the buzzer to enter the hotel. Checking in was quick with our printed Internet confirmation. As we booked a family room, we had a double bed and a sofa that could be turned into a bed and a pull out mattress to sleep our two kids. We had to convert the sofa ourselves. The room was of a good size and equivalent if not slightly larger to the HI Express hotels we have previously stayed at in London. We had a LCD tv and for the first time in years a tv in a hotel in the UK that had decent reception. The bathroom was again of a decent size with a bath/shower. You have to bring your own toiletries to a Travelodge this includes shampoo and soap. Do not worry towels, sheets, blankets and pillows are provided, even a kettle with tea and coffee. I do wonder how they get away in not providing soap for the bathroom for hygiene reasons and is unnecessary penny pinching. The bed was comfortable but we were tired after a long journey so slept well and the room was warm even though it was freezing outside. We heard no aircraft noise during our stay. There is a DLR station about 10 mins walk away (just follow the DLR bridge) and we could see the DLR trains go past from our rooms. There is also a bus stop outside the hotel. Apart from the airport there is not much there. I noticed a petrol station with a mini shop nearby. We were a short drive away from Greenwich and West Ham, two areas which we wanted to fit in during our stay. We opted for the buffet breakfast option. Although I felt the price per person was expensive, it was worth it as kids eat free and it would amount to very much the same price if we went to the nearest Starbucks for a cup of coffee and a croissant per person. This Travelodge offers a cooked breakfast with scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon as well as croissants, toasts, Kellogg's cereals. The orange juice was disappointing, it tasted like watered down squash and the coffee machine disappointed as well. I tried the cappuccino and the white coffee but it never tasted right to me. The service was efficient and you were encouraged to eat as much as you want. Generally we were impressed by our stay. Travelodge works if you book early and grab the best deals. We had a two night stay for less than one night stay at a HI Express hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Total value for money”
Reviews.Author: kpnews
Reviews.Content: Travelodge without doubt is the best value for money out there. Ok so you need to book in advance, check out the location and for the money you're paying - not expect the Ritz. We found our room clean and tidy with tea and coffee facilities although no soap or shampoo so bring your own! If you want those sort of facilities then maybe don't stay at a travelodge. (You get what you pay for). There was also a TV and a bible to keep you entertained. :) The hotel is situated directly oposite City Airport but it was not that noisy to us. But to be honest we do live on a busy main road. The airport is for small planes and jets that did not start taking off till around half 7 in the morning but possibly in the summer with the lighter morning this may be earlier. Breakfast is not included with your room. It is an extra Â£7.00 per person. The food (cereal / fruit / cooked breakfast) was ok. Nothing to shout about but adequate. The staff were friendly and helpful. We would without doubt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: swisstravels
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 2pm to be charged an extra GBP10 for ''early check-in''. Room okay and clean, certainly devoid of any toiletries, shampoo etc... The lead in price of GBP19 rocketed to GBP99 as there was a conference on at Excel, which was my only reason to stay there. There are plenty of other hotels in the area so if you get the chance, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable value”
Reviews.Author: MagicFairy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 29th August, having booked their Â£19 room deal, which is fantastic value for London. The bedroom and bathroom was clean, the bed was comfortable and there were Tea/Coffee facilities in the room. This Travelodge also has a bar/restaurant and although we didnâ€™t use it looked good value â€“ full English costing about Â£7. We wondered if it was a bit out of the way, wanting to visit the West End, but really the DLR makes it so easy. We experienced none of the rowdiness that you may get from late night clubbers in the city and being a weekend there were no planes from the small airport to disturb the peace either. The next night we stayed at Travelodge Tower Bridge and found the room there more cramped - no bedside table, just a cup size slot in the headboard and the desk/dressing table was much smaller - and a bit more down at heal. In preference, Iâ€™d definitely choose to stay at Travelodge London City Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: SallyCC
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried having read the previous recent reviews, but from the moment we arrived all staff from reception to the bar to the chambermaids were great - very friendly and professional. We parked our car, which is not posh I should add(!), in view of reception, under a light, and it remained intact throughout our 2 night stay at a weekend. 10 minutes walk to City Airport DLR station which connects pretty well with central London lines, but the underground does seem to have a lot of closures/works, so be prepared for thinking on your feet with regards to changes of lines etc. Hotel comfortable, bed ok, clean room and bathroom - request for more T bags was no problem, so all in all for Â£50 for 2 nights at a weekend, you can't really ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “What a stay! Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Sugar121
Reviews.Content: After arriving at 3.30am, we booked in to only find that we were ignored as there was a pizza delivery for the reception staff. The wrong info given to us about the pay and display car park out side and no help with getting change for this. Woke up to find out our friends car had beeen broken into and on inspection, found inadequate CCTV covering the car park (my husbands a fire/security expert so he was not impressed) and broken glas all ove the car park from previous break in's. Their plight was not helped when we found out several cars had been broken into in that car park over the week. Totally unimpressed with the breakfast as I later found the I had food poisoning from the breakfast which just set it in stone never to return there again. We had a family room which didn't have the bed made up for our son and not enough towels or pillows let alone sheets! I'll never be booking this hotel again and will not reccommend it to anyone else and will make an official complaint to Travel Lodge office.

Reviews.Title: “CRIME CENTRAL-Budget Hotel with Serious Security Issues”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeK
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Travelodge -Cheap value accomodation. The location next to the City Airport and DLR station is convenient for travelling to the hotel and into central London. Travelodge need to do something about staff training as attitude is less than helpful in most cases. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU ARE PARKING A CAR!!!!!! The most serious issue with this hotel is security in the car park at night. We went down to our car at 5am in the morning with the intention to drive to Alton Towers with the kids. We found our car and another had been broken into- Smashed passenger window and contents of glove box removed in search of Sat Navs. Reported to staff at reception who stated that it was a regular occurrence. "it always happens to the parts of the car park which can't be seen from reception." CSI attended scene several hours later reported that this was a regular stop for him. The Autoglass guy told us that this car park generated a huge amount of work for the company. "look around the car park and you can see the evidence yourself-fragments of glass from the numerous incidents" Don't let the camera fool you into thinking that this is secure. This issue could be resolved by having a fence around the edge of the grounds to limit access to the main entrance which could be monitored from reception and until this happens stay away from this hotel if you are parking a car. It cost us Â£50 excess on our insurance, Â£114 for forfeited prepaid tickets for Alton Towers, A nasty 5hr journey up the M6 on a Friday afternoon with a piece of plastic in the window and four distraught children.

Reviews.Title: “Regular car break-ins - window smashed. Not impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: JOC_2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Travelodge as we were working at Indigo2 on the Saturday night. Checked in at 3.15am Sunday morning after telling the hotel by phone we would be late - no problem and excellent service at that time of morning. Problem was that my car was broken into at 5.30am, the passenger door window was smashed. After informing the hotel management - it was a case of embarassed acceptance that it had happened many times before, its now a case of when next and they even know who the culprits are (read young hoodies) that come regularly on their pushbikes at that time of morning, seems they are after SatNavs - mines built in. The hotel security cameras are useless and do not cover the whole car park - guess where they target cars?. We waited five hours for the glass repairers - very busy as they had six similar cases that morning in the area at the budget hotels. I detect a theme here....... and the broken glass seen in daylight all over the car park tells a story - even in front of reception. Back to the hotel - grubby bar/breakfast area - the chairs and carpet were stained and there was some long term filth on the worktops. The stale smell turned out to be the guys use of a filthy mop on the serving area floor - not once did he wash it or use hot water/soap for the whole place!! The tables had that dirty cloth wiped look to them. Not impressed!!

Reviews.Title: “Second-rate”
Reviews.Author: AlaricUk
Reviews.Content: My sole purpose was in having a night stopover before taking an early business flight the next day from the nearby airport. It is not a 5 minute walk, more like 15 minutes, which makes a difference if it is raining, which it was. Poorly signposted for a pedestrian, if at all. The dreary, middle-aged woman at the desk was sulky, harrassed and rude. I was just a piece of meat to be processed as quickly as possible. I tried to crack a joke - no response whatsoever. Nearby, there was a young, black member of staff flicking coins monotonously into a drawer. After a long, stressful day, I found this really irritating.
